title: Ralf Little confirmed as Ardal O’Hanlon’s replacement on Death In Paradise
text:
Ralf Little has been confirmed to replace Ardal O’Hanlon on Death In Paradise (Picture; BBC)

Ralf Little has been confirmed as Ardal O’Hanlon’s replacement on Death In Paradise.

The 39-year-old actor was previously rumoured to be taking up the role after the BBC released a photo showing a mysterious figure looking out to sea.

His involvement has now been confirmed in newly released photos, showing Little as new character Detective Inspector Neville Parker.

In a description for the next series, Neville Parker is ‘reluctantly dispatched to the fictional island of Saint Marie to investigate the suspicious death of a woman from his home city, Manchester’.

Ralf Little will play Detective Inspector Neville Parker (Picture: BBC)

Little’s most notable roles include Antony in BBC sitcom The Royle Family and Jonny in Two Pints Of Lager And A Packet Of Crisps.

Speaking about joining the show, Little said: ‘It took less than 0.005 seconds to say yes to playing the new DI! How could I not?

‘Ardal has been wonderful in the last few series and to follow in his footsteps in a place as idyllic as Guadeloupe was a great honour and a dream come true.

‘It is a joy to play Neville and I can’t wait for viewers to see him in Paradise this series.’

Tommy Bulfin, Commissioning Editor of BBC Drama, said: ‘I am so pleased to welcome Ralf Little to the island, who we know will be brilliant in the role of D.I. Parker.

‘Death In Paradise brings escapism and joy to BBC One and I can’t wait for viewers to see what’s in store in the new year.’

Little will join series regulars Don Warrington, Tobi Bakare, Shyko Amos, Aude Legastelois, and Elizabeth Bourgine for the new series in January next year.

Ardal O’Hanlon is stepping down after three years (Picture: BBC/Red Planet Pictures/Denis Gu)

Ardal announced his departure as D.I Mooney earlier this month, explaining how he’s hoping to ‘explore other opportunities’ after three years on the show.

His exit storyline is set to play out in the upcoming series, although it’s unknown exactly how the character will leave the show.

Ralf will be the fourth lead character in Death In Paradise, following in the footsteps of Ardal, Kris Marshall, and Ben Miller.

Death In Paradise returns on BBC One in January 2020.
